content.description:
Read each question carefully. Write your response in the space provided for each part of each question. Answers must be written out in paragraph form. Outlines, bulleted lists, or diagrams alone are not acceptable and will not be scored.

The human kidney filters the blood to retain useful substances and remove waste products and excess water as urine. <math alttext="S L C 3 A 1" overflow="scroll"><mrow><mtext mathvariant="italic">SLC3A1</mtext></mrow></math> and <math alttext="S L C 7 A 9" overflow="scroll"><mrow><mtext mathvariant="italic">SLC7A9</mtext></mrow></math> are two different genes that each encode one part of a transporter protein complex typically found in the plasma membrane of human kidney cells. This transporter complex moves certain amino acids across the plasma membrane of the cells. Mutations in both the <math alttext="S L C 3 A 1" overflow="scroll"><mrow><mtext mathvariant="italic">SLC3A1</mtext></mrow></math> and <math alttext="S L C 7 A 9" overflow="scroll"><mrow><mtext mathvariant="italic">SLC7A9</mtext></mrow></math> genes are associated with increased levels of the polar amino acid cysteine in the urine, a condition called cystinuria. A researcher identified seven individuals with a family history of cystinuria. The researcher measured the concentration of cysteine in the urine of the seven individuals and sequenced their <math alttext="S L C 3 A 1" overflow="scroll"><mrow><mtext mathvariant="italic">SLC3A1</mtext></mrow></math> and <math alttext="S L C 7 A 9" overflow="scroll"><mrow><mtext mathvariant="italic">SLC7A9</mtext></mrow></math> genes to determine whether they carry functional (<math alttext="which is represented by a plus symbol" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mo>+</mo></mrow></mstyle></math>) or mutant (<math alttext="which is represented by minus symbol" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mo>−</mo></mrow></mstyle></math>) alleles of genes. The results are shown in Table 1.

TABLE 1. CHARACTERISTICS OF SEVEN INDIVIDUALS WHO CARRY AT LEAST ONE MUTANT ALLELE

<math alttext="plus" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mo>+</mo></mrow></mstyle></math> indicates the presence of a functional allele and <math alttext="minus" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mo>−</mo></mrow></mstyle></math> indicates the presence of a mutant allele.

content.question: (a) Identify the individual who most likely exhibits symptoms of cystinuria.

frqParts.text: (a) Identify the individual who most likely exhibits symptoms of cystinuria.
(b) Describe the relationship between the total number of mutant alleles in an individual and the concentration of cysteine in the urine.

(c) Evaluate the hypothesis that mutations in <math alttext="S L C 7 A 9" overflow="scroll"><mrow><mtext mathvariant="italic">SLC7A9</mtext></mrow></math> have a greater effect on the transport of cysteine across the plasma membrane of kidney cells than do mutations in <math alttext="S L C 3 A 1" overflow="scroll"><mstyle mathvariant="italic"><mrow><mtext>SLC3A1</mtext></mrow></mstyle></math>.
(d) Explain how the data support the claim that cysteine is a large polar molecule.

skill.text: 4.B: Describe data from a table or graph, including: i. identifying specific data points ii. describing trends and patterns in the data iii. describing relationships between variables
